body_html: I think by context vector you mean just the state after the encoder. For example, in [https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/seq2seq_test.py#L34](this test) it would be the enc_state tensor.
body_text: I think by context vector you mean just the state after the encoder. For example, in [https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/seq2seq_test.py#L34](this test) it would be the enc_state tensor.
body: I think by context vector you mean just the state after the encoder. For example, in [https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/seq2seq_test.py#L34](this test) it would be the `enc_state` tensor.
